comments.body:
To be more specific:

The `offset` argument to _numpy.memmap_ gets (more or less directly) passed to Python's _mmap.mmap_. In the _mmap_ docstring, it says

> offset may be specified as a non-negative integer offset. mmap references will be relative to the offset from the beginning of the file. offset defaults to 0. offset must be a multiple of the ALLOCATIONGRANULARITY.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +69,73 @@        additional data. By default, ``memmap`` will start at the beginning of
        the file, even if ``filename`` is a file pointer ``fp`` and
        ``fp.tell() != 0``.
    shape : tuple, optional
        The desired shape of the array. If ``mode == 'r'`` and the number
